name: Sofitel Wanda Chengdu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 5* hotel. about 25 mins walk from centre of town. Double rooms (at least) have a clear glass window between the bedroom and bathroom so you'd want to be very good friends if you're sharing a room. Concierge were very helpful very information regarding excursions.
reviews.title: Good value 5* hotel

reviews.text: Had a very concerning experience when a taxi driver came to my room demanding more money. How did he get my room number? How was he allowed to the 18th floor? Explanation & resolution was unsatisfactory. Would be expected from a locally managed hotel, but, very surprising for a Sofitel. If looking for service, for the price point, probably better to pay a little more and stay at the Shangri La.
reviews.title: Not sure if management has changed....

reviews.text: The hotel to stay in Chengdu considering location, size of the room, facilities.
reviews.title: VERY PLEASANT STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small restaurants in the street behind the hotel (300 meters) make it easy to enjoy Sichuan food.
reviews.title: Great Respite in Chengdu

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for, literally, about 5 hours on a layover en route to Hong Kong. We figured that since we were staying for such a short time, we'd take a chance on a cheap hotel (we paid $95 for the night (includes taxes, etc.) through Travelocity.com). I wish we could have stayed longer! The room was great - I was definitely expecting something seedy for the price. Not the case. The only semi-snag we hit was upon check-in, the front desk tried to charge us extra for hotel taxes. I pointed out on our Travelocity reservation print-out that it said Taxes and Fees: ALL INCLUDED. Apparently this settled it, and we were not charged further. That aside, all was great - the room was nicely appointed. The shower situation was a little interesting - would be especially so if you didn't want the person you were traveling with to see you shower! (It was an all glass stall shower, but was not enclosed within the bathroom; it was open to the rest of the room!) All in all, great for the purpose of our brief layover.
reviews.title: Great deal for the money

reviews.text: Most recent stay for three nights - have stayed at the same hotel on two previous occasions and haven't really seen much change - apart from the addition of a computer in the room. Breakfast a little poor - stale cereal and filter coffee like treacle - although did provide fresh coffee upon request. Bit of a puzzle trying to find things at breakfast - milk nowhere near the cereal, fruit juice in one place, freshly squeezed juice in another. Evening buffet menu fine as long as you liked seafood - ended up going a la carte, but still a decent amount of choice available. Had a lazy day - so put on the do not disturb card and light - only to get a phonecall from housekeeping asking when I would be leaving the room so that they could clean it! Not the best hotel in Chengdu I have stayed in, but not too bad.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - but could be improved

reviews.text: Stayed here recently after a 1-year hiatus of sampling other Chengdu hotels and can say definitively that I did not miss this hotel a single bit. In fact, as this hotel grows in age, my tolerance for the terrible service here gets less and less.
reviews.title: Not well-managed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: nice hotel, staff could improve

reviews.text: * The rooms remain fairly comfortable - the larger suites offer plenty of room, standard comfortable sofitel bed and linens, and they now have flat screen tv's.
reviews.title: All style and no substance

reviews.text: This is a first class modern hotel well located in Chengdu.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — the morning breakfast was a bit expensive and plain.

reviews.text: The price is right, the services are excellent. The rooms I stayed in were clean, very modern, great bed and pillows and bathroom facilities, wonderful and prompt service.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience at Sofitel

likes.disliked: — Hmm, sorry, nothing bad to say about it.

reviews.text: When I needed a toe cutting done, they provided a first rate person who took great care of my toes!
reviews.title: Gem of Chengdu!

likes.disliked: — Front desk staff not aware of SOFITEL Privilege Card's Privilege and super expensive minibar!

reviews.title: Sofitel
reviews.text: There is great internet access as part of price of hotel for which they should be highly complimented!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sofitel in Chengdu for 2 nights for a business trip. Loved it! The lobby and rooms are beautifully appointed, beds are super comfy, the service is very friendly and helpful although a bit laid back (but not any more so than the rest of Chengdu!), the location is terrific--right across the street from the river walkway and just around the corner from stores and restaurants. Breakfast is very good, especially the Chinese one. Hope you will have as nice of an experience as I did--wish I could return soon.
reviews.title: Stay at the Sofitel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was one of the better sofitels we stayed in on our China trip. The location was great being on the river (albeit a dirty river), pretty close to the CBD.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
wonderful hotel
reviews.text: The room itself was nice and spacious and had a very comfortable bed. It was a little weird how the bathroom is seperated from the bedroom with a glass wall, no electronic curtain or anything to make it less visible.

reviews.title: Ever hear of this before?????
reviews.text: The swimming pool was great, but the spa was ice cold. However they do have a seperate sauna/spa with 3 seperate temperates which were nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately come back here and recommend it to anyone travelling to Chengdu.
reviews.title: Bad Service

reviews.text: Our stay here was fantastic, from the huge clean beautiful room to the service. Any request we had, for more bottled water or for more pillows for example, was filled within 3 minutes. I actually timed it! The bed was the most comfortable we've ever slept in.The location was perfect, alongside a river with a fantastic river walk, and was central to stores and restaurants. Staying here has made me interested in staying in other Sofitel hotels in other countries, to see if they measure up to this one. I heartily recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great service, good location

description: Sofitel Wanda Chengdu is located on the Funan River, just 20-minutes drive from Chengdu Shuangliu international airport and 15-minutes walk from Central Square and the commercial hub of the city. The hotel features 262 elegant rooms, 3 restaurants, 4 bars, a heated indoor swimming pool, sauna, spa and gymnasium. Conference facilities are also available for up to 500 delegates.
